intro: Bouchetia arniatera, commonly known as the white-flowered bouchetia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters, with smooth, grayish bark and elliptical leaves. Its flowers are borne in clusters and are pollinated primarily by bees and other insects, contributing to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
